info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 8:31AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wadena and Otter Tail Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 830 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Amor, or 16 miles northeast of Fergus Falls, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Amor around 835 AM CDT. Ottertail Lake around 840 AM CDT. Battle Lake around 845 AM CDT. Clitherall around 905 AM CDT. Ottertail around 925 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Fergus Falls Airport. This includes Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 39 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
